title: Do ypu know what's the name of this types?

comments.content:
And the name of them

5.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Imagrod_3765.jpg)

6.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/imagroig_3434.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/1_4663.jpg)

Thanks a lot

Marilyn Monroe is Kabel.

Satyricon looks like Big Caslon - it is a caslon anyway.

I take it these are from _U&lc_ or _Avant Garde_? In that case many of these might be the hand lettering of [Herb Lubalin](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Herb%252BLubalin) and [Ed Benguiat](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Ed%252BBenguiat), not typefaces, or photo type that has not been digitized.

Thanks folks!!  
Do you know the others types?

Thank you very much!  
and do you know the name of nº3 “letters to the..” and “new york”?

Letters to the editor is ITC Hawthorn, with a custom R.

[http://www.linotype.com/89214/hawthorn-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908/http:/www.linotype.com/89214/hawthorn-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/89214/hawthorn-family.html")

dr

New York, adapted from Lubalin’s hand written business card, might have been adapted in a typeface, I just can not get track of it now. I thought it was ITC Galliard, but apparently not.

dr

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/herb-lubalin-type-design_5114.gif)

EDIT: for the capital swashes, the closest match would be Farnham:

[http://christianschwartz.com/farnham.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908/http:/christianschwartz.com/farnham.shtml "http://christianschwartz.com/farnham.shtml")

dr

I doubt that “New York” is available in any digital typeface. But Hoefler Text Italic Swash SC will get you close. (Closer even than Farnham, I think.)

[http://www.typography.com/testDriver/index.php?productLineID=100010&styl...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908/http:/www.typography.com/testDriver/index.php?productLineID=100010&styleID=600147 "http://www.typography.com/testDriver/index.php?productLineID=100010&styleID=600147")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/HFJ_NewYork_4052.png)

(Closer even than Farnham, I think.)

indeed... that’s right. I missed that one.

dr
